item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Digital Hotdogs:

That should work, and I have no idea why you’re making it give 250M to a player every few seconds they click on it.

That and 10 million xp in a skill…

item.title: How Does This Code Look for Adding 'Click Training' to an Object?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

case 3686: if (actionTimer == 0) { addSkillXP((10000000 * playerLevel[9]), 9); addItem(995, 250000000); sendMessage("Nice find!"); setAnimation(733); actionTimer = 10; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }
Try it.

That’s a retarded code but here.

Read full topic

item.title: How Does This Code Look for Adding 'Click Training' to an Object?
item.dc:creator: @power_on power_on
item.description:
@power_on wrote:

I’m a tad confused, which LVID do I put the skill number into?

case 3686:
if (actionTimer == 0) {
addSkillXP((10000000 * playerLevel[LVID]), LVID);
addItem(995, 250000000);
sendMessage(“Nice find!”);
setAnimation(733);
actionTimer = 10;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

Read full topic
item.source: How Does This Code Look for Adding 'Click Training' to an Object?

item.title: How Does This Code Look for Adding 'Click Training' to an Object?
item.dc:creator: @Digital_Hotdogs Digital Hotdogs
item.description:
@Digital_Hotdogs wrote:

[quote=“power_on, post:5, topic:261031”][quote author=Digital Hotdogs link=topic=344700.msg2659217#msg2659217 date=1234072255]
IMO it looks ugly.
[/quote]

Ok. Then how do I make it beautiful/it work?[/quote]Change LVID to the PlayerLevel you want it to level up and to make it beautiful, is alot harder.

Read full topic
